item.title: Complete Outer Worlds 2 Trophy & Achievement Guide
item.description:
The Outer Worlds 2 is a deep RPG with a huge list of achievements you can get by completing specific objectives or challenges. Though you can get almost all Outer Worlds 2 achievements on a single playthrough (especially if you make regular save files), most players will have to complete several runs to get every trophy in the game.

Outer Worlds 2 achievements range all over the place in terms of difficulty. You'll unlock an achievement for discovering Paradise or for collecting your first Pitchball card, for example, but you'll have to go through quite a lot of effort to unlock achievements like Corporation Cooperation, Capture The Archive The Hard Way, or Winning Hearts and Heads.

This guide explains how to get all 48 achievements in The Outer Worlds 2 , including tips and tricks you can use to 100% the game.

Collectibles & Unique Items

A Journey Of A Thousand Miles

  • Collected 1 Pitch/Tossball card

To get the A Journey Of A Thousand Miles achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must simply collect a single Pitchball or Tossball card.

Whew, That’s Enough!

  • Collected 100 Pitch/Tossball cards

To get the Whew, That’s Enough! achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must collect a staggering 100 Pitchball or Tossball cards (in any combination of both). Keep a keen eye out for these tiny rectangular collectibles in every area of the game.

Left To Your Own Device

  • Acquired the Rift Anomaly Modulator

To get the Left To Your Own Device achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must get the Rift Anomaly Modulator. You will acquire this Gadget, which can temporarily reset the havoc caused by a Rift Anomaly, as part of the main story on Praetor.

Rift Drifter

  • Explored all of the localized rifts around Arcadia

To get the Rift Drifter achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must discover and recalibrate every Rift Anomaly across all explorable areas in Outer Worlds 2 . This includes all four main planets (Paradise, Golden Ridge, Cloister, and Praetor), as well as both Free Market Station and the ACS Undisputed Claim.

SA Quarterlies Quantified

  • Found all volumes of Science Adventures Quarterly on Paradise Island

To get the SA Quarterlies Quantified achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must locate all 10 copies of Science Adventures Quarterly – check out our full guide here!

Golden Ridge Murals in Plural

  • Found all of the mural pieces on Golden Ridge

To get the Golden Ridge Murals in Plural achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must locate all 5 Murals on Golden Ridge – check out our full guide here!

Cloister Excogitation Logs CEL-ebration

  • Found all of the Excogitation audio logs on Cloister

To get the Cloister Excogitation Logs CEL-ebration achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must find all four Excogitation Chapels and all four Sojourner's Logs on Cloister - check out our full guide here!

Praetor Towers Powered

  • Recalibrated all of the grounding stations on Praetor

To get the Praetor Towers Powered achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must successfully find and repower every Grounding Station and Lightning Tower on Praetor - check out our full guide here!

Flawed Hero

  • Accepted 3 Flaws

To get the Flawed Hero achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must trigger, then select, three different Flaws. Flaws will appear as a pop-up after performing certain actions in-game (or by purchasing the Premium Edition for the Consumerist flaw), and cannot be reversed once selected.

Hatchling Catcher

  • Collected 5 pets for your ship

To get the Hatchling Catcher achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must unlock 5 different pets for Incognito. You get one for purchasing the Premium Edition, three can be found or purchased on Paradise, and many more can be found on the other explorable locations in the game.

Winning Hearts and Heads

  • Collected 20 human hearts

To get the Winning Hearts and Heads achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must pick up the Serial Killer perk, then kill 20 Human characters and harvest their Human Heart item, which only appears if you have this perk. You must also get the Psychopath perk to get the Serial Killer perk.

Companions & Factions

One for All

  • Recruited all companions

To get the One for All achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must recruit all six available companions in the game. You get Niles and VAL at the start of the game, find Inez on Paradise, Aza and Marisol on Golden Ridge, and Tristan on Free Market Station.

All for One

  • Completed all companion quests

To get the All for One achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must complete all companion quests for all six companions. Look for each companion's icon next to missions in your journal to see which are considered companion quests. All companions have several steps to their companion quests, so be sure to check in regularly to see if there are new steps that must be completed.

All for None

  • Have every living companion die or abandon you for good

To get the All for None achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must send every available companion off the Incognito and end their partnership, or let every companion permanently die. You can't reset to a previous save – all companions must be dead or gone at the same time.

AC: All Complete

  • Completed all faction quests for Auntie’s Choice

To get the AC: All Complete achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must finish the entire Auntie's Choice questline. To do this, you must complete all of Auntie's Choice's requests to get their help with The Archive, then officially solicit their aid in this final step of the game.

OA: Objectives Accomplished

  • Completed all faction quests for the Order of the Ascendant

To get the OA: Objectives Accomplished achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must finish the entire Order of the Ascendant questline. To do this, you must complete all of The Order's requests to get their help with The Archive, then officially solicit their aid in this final step of the game.

Corporation Cooperation

  • Convinced Auntie’s Choice and the Order of the Ascendant to work together

To get the Corporation Cooperation achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must complete both the Auntie's Choice and Order of the Ascendant faction questlines, then convince both factions to work together as you solicit both of the organizations' aid as you take on The Archive.

Destroyer of Worlds

  • Reached the lowest possible standing with Auntie’s Choice and the Order of the Ascendant

To get the Destroyer of Worlds achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must completely ruin their reputation with both the Order of the Ascendant and Auntie's Choice. The easiest way to do this is to kill everyone in major settlements associated with these factions, like Matriarch's Mercy on Golden Ridge and Fairfield on Paradise.

Combat Challenges

Ad Hominem Homicide

  • Killed 10 enemies that are taunted by the Popup Gun’s Ad Drones

To get the Ad Hominem Homicide achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must purchase the Popup Gun on the ACS Undisputed Claim, then kill 10 enemies with its Ad drones that explode upon reloading.

Dance Dance Disfiguration

  • Killed 10 enemies with the Spectrum Dance Saber while in Spectrum Rainbow mode

To get the Dance Dance Disfiguration achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must purchase the Spectrum Dance Saber on Free Market Station, which changes colors and effects, then defeat 10 enemies while it is in Rainbow mode.

Elemental Maelstrom

  • Killed a single enemy that has been affected by all possible damage types

To get the Elemental Maelstrom achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must kill an enemy that has been affected by Corrosion, Frost, N-Ray, Physical, Plasma, and Shock damage. Have weapons capable of dealing each of these damage types in your inventory, then swap between them in the midst of combat against a Strong foe.

Float Like A Butterfly, Sting Like A Bee

  • Killed 5 enemies while hovering in the Zyranium Automech Suit

To get the Float Like A Butterfly, Sting Like A Bee achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must acquire the Zyranium Automech Suit in the Automech facility on Praetor. Engage its Hover function and kill 5 total enemies while you float in mid-air.

Go Out With A Bang

  • Killed 3 enemies with a single shot of the Big Bang

To get the Go Out With A Bang achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must find the Big Bang inside of the EARL building on Cloister, then use it to kill three enemies at once with a single shot. Weaken a handful of enemies to low HP, then use this to finish them off and get the 'chieve.

Never Seen

  • Killed 50 enemies with Sneak Attacks

To get the Never Seen achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must defeat a total of 50 enemies with Sneak attacks. You must deal the killing blow with a Sneak Attack, not just deal Sneak damage to it. Be sure to pick up the Lucky Trait to give yourself a little bit of extra Crit Chance to get the killing blow instantly from stealth.

Scary GARY Adversary

  • Killed 5 enemies with Gary’s tendrils

To get the Scary GARY Adversary achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must acquire the GARY armor piece by using the Rift Modulator on a rift near the Bridge of the Revenant on Paradise. Deal the killing blow with one of the tendrils created by GARY's unique effect five times to get this achievement.

Stompy

  • Killed 5 enemies by stomping on them after hitting them with the Shrink Ray

To get the Stompy achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must acquire the Shrink Ray from the Crabble Spawning Grounds on Paradise by using the Rift Modulator on a Rift Anomaly there. Shrink and step on a total of 5 enemies with the Shrink Ray to get this achievement.

Stop Hitting Yourself

  • Killed 15 enemies using only Armageddon

To get the Stop Hitting Yourself achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must acquire the Armageddon weapon by using the Rift Modulator on a Rift Anomaly near the location where you first acquired this gadget. Defeat 15 enemies by exclusively using the Armageddon and no other weapons.

Waylaid Grenades

  • Shot 3 grenades out of the air

To get the Waylaid Grenades achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must use the Time-Dialation gadget to slow down time, then carefully shoot three total incoming grenades. Shooting a grenade while it is in mid-air will cause it to explode pre-emptively.

Well Dressed

  • Defeated the Consul while wearing clothing instead of armor

To get the Well Dressed achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must defeat the Consul of the Protectorate without wearing any traditional armor. Unequip your armor and only equip 'clothing' type equipment, if any at all.

Misc Challenges

Anti-Consumerist

  • Completed the game without spending a single bit

To get the Anti-Consumerist achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must beat the game without ever spending any money. This includes Vendors, of course, as well as bribes and other ways you might spend your hard-earned Bits.

A Stiff In The Rift

  • Jumped into a rift (and died)

To get the A Stiff In The Rift achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must simply walk straight into a Rift Anomaly without using the Rift Modulator on it. This will kill you, so be sure to quicksave beforehand.

Auntie’s Old Acquaintance

  • Met Amos

To get the Auntie’s Old Acquaintance achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must find Amos on the ACS Undisputed Claim. Locating Amos is part of a mission you will be offered by an NPC after traveling deeper into the Auntie's Choice flagship.

Capture The Archive The Hard Way

  • Took control of the Archive without any backup

To get the Capture The Archive The Hard Way achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must avoid getting the help of either Auntie's Choice or the Order of the Ascendant in their attempt to take on The Archive – you must do it completely alone to get this achievement.

Chemically Dependent

  • Crashed 20 times with the Medical Inhaler

To get the Chemically Dependent achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must Crash a total of 20 times. You will Crash if you go over your Toxicity maximum while using the Inhaler.

Corpse Warper

  • Melted 20 bodies with Auntie’s Acidic Dematerializer

To get the Corpse Warper achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must acquire the Auntie's Acidic Dematerializer gadget from the High-Security Lockboxes aboard the Incognito, then use it to remove 20 total dead enemies.

Everything Must Go

  • Earned 50,000 bits by selling items to vendors

To get the Everything Must Go achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must sell a whopping 50,000 Bits worth of any goods to vendors. The easiest way to get this is to sell, not break down, your gathered Junk items every time you visit a vendor, though you will of course lose out on valuable crafting materials.

Hatchling Hunter

  • Killed a total of 50 Rapitdon Juveniles, Crabble Hatchlings, Mantiwasps, Spiderlings, or Critters

To get the Hatchling Hunter achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must simply kill any combination of Raptidon Juveniles, Crabble Hatchlings, Spiderlings, Mantiwasps, or non-aggressive Critters found on each planet. The easiest way to get this is to progress and explore as normal, but shoot every Critter you run across.

Level 30

  • Reached Level 30

To get the Level 30 achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must simply reach the maximum level in the game.

Maximum Gun

  • Fully leveled-up Rookie’s Reward

To get the Maximum Gun achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must acquire the Rookie's Reward gun by unlocking the locked hatch in the pet room of the Incognito (or by turning off the power in the room with a hidden switch), then defeat enough enemies with the Rookie's Reward equipped to level it up to max.

Skilled

  • Raised a Skill to level 20

To get the Skilled achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must simply maximize any one Skill. You get two Skill Points every level, so you can theoretically get this Achievement by Level 10 if you focus exclusively on one Skill.

Upgrades Available

  • Applied modifications to 10 weapons or armors

To get the Upgrades Available achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must use the Workbench to apply any combination of 10 Weapon or Armor mods to your equipment. Equipping modded weapons or armor does not count.

Progression & Game Completion

Welcome to Paradise Island

  • Landed on Paradise Island

To get the Welcome to Paradise Island achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must beat the introductory segment at Horizon Point Station, then navigate to Paradise Island.

Vexed the Vox

  • Infiltrated and escaped the Vox Relay

To get the Vexed the Vox achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must complete the main mission of Paradise Island by reaching, and escaping, the Vox Relay. It does not matter where you choose to send the Vox Relay when given the choice at the end of the zone.

Desperate Times Call for Monastic Measures

  • Stopped de Vries’ conspirators in Alexandra Monastery

To get the Desperate Times Call for Monastic Measures achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must complete the main mission of Golden Ridge by defeating de Vries' allies in the Order at the top of the Alexandra Monastery, an instanced sub-zone not available until you progress the main story.

Revive The Archive

  • Restored the Archive to its fully functional state

To get the Revive The Archive achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must successfully take on The Archive on Cloister (with or without either main faction's help).

The Outer Worlds 2

  • Completed the game on any difficulty

To get The Outer Worlds 2 achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must simply beat the game on any difficulty. You will get this achievement alongside the Hard or Very Hard achievements.

Hard

  • Completed the game on Hard difficulty

To get the Hard achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must complete an entire playthrough with the Hard difficulty enabled.

Very Hard

  • Completed the game on Very Hard difficulty

To get the Very Hard achievement, Outer Worlds 2 players must complete an entire playthrough with the Very Hard difficulty enabled.

Unique PS Trophy: You've Given 110%

  • Unlocked all other trophies

To get the You've Given 110% trophy, Outer Worlds 2 players must get every other achievement in this list. This Trophy is exclusive to the PlayStation version of Outer Worlds 2 and is not listed amongst other achievements on Xbox or Steam.

The Outer Worlds 2
9 /10
9.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

item.title: Features Coming With the Animal Crossing New Horizons Update
item.description:
Animal Crossing: New Horizons launched in March 2020, and it was a hit on release. Many players in the gaming community were playing Animal Crossing on a regular basis for months after it became available. The game received updates and additional content until November 2021; after this, there were no significant patches or major changes made to New Horizons .

Fans were taken by surprise when Nintendo announced a major free update for early 2026. Animal Crossing: New Horizons v3.0 is set to release alongside the Nintendo Switch 2 edition of the game on January 15, 2026 . This guide lists the various features that have been confirmed for the upcoming Switch & Switch 2 update.

Crafting in Bulk

The Most Highly Requested QOL Feature

The ability to craft items in bulk seemed to be completely overlooked during the creation of Animal Crossing: New Horizons . As soon as players got their hands on the game back in 2020, they immediately pointed this out and asked for it to be added. It should've happened five years ago, but unfortunately, it ended up not being part of New Horizons .

This feature would've been extremely useful for gamers designing their islands and homes in Animal Crossing . However, it's better late than never, so fans will be happy to know that it is one of the features being introduced to Animal Crossing: New Horizons in the January update.

Storage Improvements

No Need to Dispose of Any More Rare Flowers

Even though 5,000 storage size might sound like a lot at first, players will soon find out that it's not enough after sinking a couple of hundred hours into the game. There are so many resources, diverse clothes, and beautiful furniture items in Animal Crossing: New Horizons that it's easy to fill up a home's storage without even trying.

Thankfully, the upcoming update will make it possible for players to upgrade their home's storage two additional times, allowing them to store up to 9,000 items - nearly double its current maximum size. This is a must, especially with all the new items that will become available once the update launches.

Storage will also receive another improvement; players will finally be able to store trees, shrubs, and flowers in storage, which means they won't have to dispose of them if they want to temporarily move them.

Resetti's Reset Service

Swiftly Clean Up the Island

Resetti was added to Animal Crossing: New Horizons in a previous update, and he helped players get out of tight situations with his rescue services. Starting in January, Resetti will provide a clean-up service that will be extremely useful for players who want to redecorate their island.

When players speak to Resetti, they will be able to ask him to "reset" a certain area, the island's beaches, or the entire island. This will remove any placed furniture and move it into storage. Additionally, players can ask him to get rid of custom designs and flowers - the latter can be placed in storage or in the trash.

Zelda and Splatoon Villagers

Get Your Favorite Crossover Characters to Visit

Nintendo is adding tons of crossover items to Animal Crossing: New Horizons , but that's not all. Characters from other Nintendo franchises are coming to Animal Crossing as villagers, and they may appear in the player's campsite at any time.

In the announcement trailer, four new villagers were revealed. Tulin and Mineru from The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom are joining the roster of Animal Crossing villagers as bird and deer villagers, respectively. Cece and Viché are based on Callie and Marie from the Splatoon series.

Both Cece and Viché were part of Animal Crossing: New Leaf . However, their design was different. Alongside these two villagers, players could also scan the Inkling amiibo in order to get Inkwell to appear. It is possible that Nintendo hasn't revealed all the crossover villagers coming to Animal Crossing and that more themed villagers will be added with the update, such as Ganon, Wolf Link, Epona, and Medli.

Slumber Islands

Effortlessly Make the Island of Your Dreams

When players lie down in a bed in Animal Crossing: New Horizons , they will see a new prompt that says, "It's slumber time." If they choose this option, they will be taken to Slumber Island, which is Animal Crossing 's take on creative mode.

In a Slumber Island, gamers will be able to freely place any item in their catalog, add trees and shrubbery, terraform, place bridges and stairs, and even select the current weather and time of day. This can be a nice change of scenery from the current season, an escape from a cluttered island, or just a fun way to come up with more designs after finishing an island. In total, players can create up to three Slumber Islands, whether they're small, medium, or large.

Kapp'n's Family Hotel

Help Run a Family Business

With the free update, Kapp'n's family will be opening a resort on the island pier. Guests from all over will appear and visit the player's island, so they have to help out by decorating several rooms in the hotel. In exchange, the player will receive hotel tickets, which can be used to purchase souvenirs in the shop. The hotel shop has exclusive items that cannot be found at Nook's Cranny or Paradise Planning.

Guests will appear at the hotel, or players can invite them with an Amiibo. They can hang out in their room, borrow a hotel outfit, and explore the island.

34
8.7 /10
9 /10

Animal Crossing: New Horizons

item.title: Where to Find All Praetor Grounding Stations in Outer Worlds 2
item.description:
There are four main missions in The Outer Worlds 2 that are categorized as collection quests, one in each region. One on Paradise asks players to collect Science Magazines, one on Golden Ridge asks players to recover Murals, and one on Cloister asks players to find Excogitation Logs. The Praetor collection quest tasks players to recalibrate Lightning Towers throughout the region by using terminals at nearby Grounding Stations.

In total, there are five Grounding Stations Outer Worlds 2 players can find, each one tied to one of five Lightning Towers. This guide explains where to start this collection quest, provides useful tips to help players find every Lightning Tower in Outer Worlds 2 , and details what you get for finding all five Grounding Station locations.

How to Start The Praetor Collection Quest

Where to Start 'Fiddling With Fulgurating Fulminations' in Outer Worlds 2

To start the Fiddling With Fulgurating Fulminations mission, Outer Worlds 2 players have two options: either talk to Exemplar Simon (of the Order of the Ascendant) at the Grounding Station in the southeast of the zone, or find and repair a Lightning Tower independent of talking to Exemplar Simon.

To get to the Grounding Station and meet Exemplar Simon, head to the far east of Praetor, between the Auntie's Choice settlement in the southeast and the central Automech facility. Follow the path that winds behind the Grounding Station to reach Exemplar Simon in the raised lift.

If you are able to locate and fix a Lightning Tower before meeting Exemplar Simon, you will automatically start the Fiddling With Fulgurating Fulminations mission. However, you must find your way to Exemplar Simon upon completing the mission to get the rewards.

Where To Find All Grounding Stations in Outer Worlds 2

Every Grouding Station Location on Praetor

Outer Worlds 2 Lightning Tower 1: Southeast of the Tomb of the Matriarch

  • Location Notes : The Grounding Station at this location is missing a part. To get this part, you must venture to the east and into a Scrapper camp. Defeat the Scrappers, get the Replacement Part off of a table, then put it back into the port at the station to activate this terminal.

Outer Worlds 2 Lightning Tower 2: West of the Northwestern Bridge

  • Location Notes : The path to this area is infested with Verachnids - the main bug enemy on Praetor. Quick-save before you make your way up the hill to this Grounding Station in case you get swarmed.

Outer Worlds 2 Lightning Tower 3: Southeast from the Grounding Tower

  • Location Notes : The area surrounding this Grounding Station is infested with Mantid enemies (though not nearly as many as the previous Lightning Tower). Defeat these wasps, then enter the station to recalibrate the nearby Lightning Tower.

Outer Worlds 2 Lightning Tower 4: South of Automech Facility

  • Location Notes : The door to this Grounding Station is locked. You must either have a high enough Lockpick skill to break open the front door, or navigate to the rooftop and drop down. Be careful of the warring Raptidon and Protectorate enemies around this area.

Outer Worlds 2 Lightning Tower 5: South of the Rift Modulator Location

  • Location Notes : To get to this Grounding Station, you must have found the Rift Modulator. This can be found at the facility just to the north of the location marked on the map above. Once acquired, use it on the Rifts around the Grounding Station to give yourself a way to jump onto the top of the station. Drop down inside to recalibrate the nearby Lightning Tower.

Fiddling With Fulgurating Fulminations Quest Reward

What Do You Get For Finding Every Grouding Station in Outer Worlds 2?

For completing the Praetor Grounding Station mission, Outer Worlds 2 players will earn a chunk of XP and a handful of unique Storm Grenades , as well as the recipe to craft them. Storm Grenades are unique because they stick to enemies, increasing incoming Shock damage and calling down the lightning storms of Praetor if used while on the planet.

Exemplar Simon gives you 10x Storm Grenades for completing the mission. To get more, you will need to combine 1x Voltspore, 3x Energy Canister, and 1x Black Powder at a crafting bench.

You will also unlock the 'Praetor Towers Powered' achievement, which is a Bronze Trophy on PlayStation and worth 15 Gamerscore on Xbox.

The Outer Worlds 2
9 /10
9.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB

item.title: Where to Find All Golden Ridge Murals in Outer Worlds 2
item.description:
There are four main missions in The Outer Worlds 2 that are categorized as collection quests, one in each region. One on Paradise asks players to collect Science Magazines, one on Cloister asks players to find Excogitation Logs, and one on Praetor asks players to recalibrate Lightning Towers. The Golden Ridge collection quest tasks players to recover mural pieces from Tramicular Stations throughout the zone.

In total, there are five murals Outer Worlds 2 players can find, each a piece of a greater completed mural. This guide explains where to start this collection quest, offers players useful tips on where to find every mural in Outer Worlds 2 , and what you get for finding all five mural locations.

How to Start The Golden Ridge Collection Quest

Where to Start 'The Pursuit of the Partite Pentaptych' in Outer Worlds 2

To start the Golden Ridge collection mission to recover all murals, Outer Worlds 2 must simply locate one of the five different mural pieces in the region. Unlike the other three region-specific collection quests in Outer Worlds 2 , The Pursuit of the Partite Pentaptych (which is technically associated the Order of the Ascendant) does not have a quest-giver.

As such, when you complete this mission and successfully recover all five mural pieces in Golden Ridge, the quest will complete automatically.

Where To Find All Murals in Outer Worlds 2

Every Mural Location on Golden Ridge

Outer Worlds 2 Mural Location 1: Alexandra Tram Station

  • Location Notes : Found on the west side of the station below the Landing Pad on Golden Ridge.

Outer Worlds 2 Mural Location 2: Guardian Estates Tram Station

  • Location Notes : Enter the estate proper, then turn left and look for the Tramicular Station sign.

Outer Worlds 2 Mural Location 3: Decommissioned Autonomous Extractorium Tram Station

  • Location Notes : In a building to the west of the Decommissioned Autonomous Extractorium facility, not in the facility itself.

Outer Worlds 2 Mural Location 4: N-Ray Range Tram Station

  • Location Notes : Enter the N-Ray Range then look for a building on the right to find the ruined Tramicular station here.

Outer Worlds 2 Mural Location 5: Alexandra Monastery Tram Station

  • Location Notes : After you gain entry into the Alexandra Monastery, get to the Orrery (just before the Order Initiate Scavenger Hunt puzzle room), then go south to find the Tram Station here.

The Pursuit of the Partite Pentaptych Quest Reward

What Do You Get For Finding Every Mural in Outer Worlds 2?

As you continue to collect murals in Outer Worlds 2 , you will level up a unique perk tied to this collection mission: Art Enthusiast. This perk cannot be selected in the regular perk menu when you level up (on even levels). You will automatically get the Art Enthusiast perk upon acquiring your first Golden Ridge mural.

At first, the Art Enthusiast perk grants a total 2% extra XP for companion kills , which counts when your companion gets the killing blow on an enemy. For every mural you find, you will increase this bonus by 2% , up to a maximum of 10% at rank 5 at end of quest.

In addition to this maximum-leveled Art Enthusiast perk and the XP you get for completing the mission, you will also notice a new decoration aboard the Incognito. Step onto your ship (or fast travel to it to enter it instantly from anywhere), and look above the staircase to your right as you enter the main room.

Your ultimate reward for completing the Golden Ridge mural collection mission is that you get to display all five pieces as a trophy aboard the Incognito. Any time you want, you can reference the lore displayed on each of the five tablets.

You don't have to be right next to it to inspect your trophy murals – you can inspect it from the balcony just opposite.

Additionally, you will earn the achievement Golden Ridge Murals in Plural. On Xbox, this achievement is worth 15 Gamerscore, while on PlayStation, this trophy is considered a Bronze trophy.

The Outer Worlds 2
9 /10
9.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

item.title: Upcoming Action RPGs With Combo Systems
item.description:
The year is quickly coming to a close, but there are still so many great games on the horizon. Shooter fans are getting Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 , turn-based RPG fans are getting Dragon Quest 1 & 2 HD-2D Remake , and there’s even a big racing game via Kirby Air Riders .

Is there something for the action RPG fans to get excited for, too? There may not be that many left in 2025, but there are some exciting action RPGs with killer-looking combos coming relatively soon in 2026. For anyone who likes to master combat, these RPGs are worth putting on a wishlist.

Where Winds Meet

An Open-World Wuxia

Where Winds Meet
Action RPG
Wuxia
Open-World
Systems
Released
November 14, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Everstone Studios
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC, PS5
Powered by
  • Planned Release Date: 11/14/25
  • Planned Systems: Mobile, PC, and PS5

Where Winds Meet is an upcoming free-to-play action RPG set in an open world. What sets it apart is the self-described Wuxia style of combat, and anyone familiar with that term may know it from Chinese cinematic stories like Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon .

There are a lot of spins and aerial effects to combat shown so far, and it looks like it could be intense in the game. Another thing that sets it apart from the open-world genre is that four players can explore the world and enjoy the mixed martial arts combat together.

The Legend Of Heroes: Trails Beyond The Horizon

The Best Of Turn-Based And Action

The Legend of Heroes: Trails Beyond the Horizon
RPG
JRPG
Action
Adventure
Action RPG
Systems
Released
January 15, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen / Fantasy Violence, Sexual Themes, Language, Simulated Gambling
Developer(s)
Nihon Falcom, PH3 GmbH
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2, PC
Powered by
  • Planned Release Date: 1/15/26
  • Planned Systems: PC, PS4, PS5, Switch, and Switch 2

The Legend of Heroes: Trails Beyond the Horizon was originally released in 2024 in Japan, but the West will finally catch up in January. Like the latest entry that came out in 2025, Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter , this next game gives players the ability to fight most battles with turn-based or real-time combat.

Players can sync standard and magical abilities together and even combo with other party members. This combat structure is why the Trails series is so popular among RPG fans, even though overall it’s a bit more niche than something like Final Fantasy .

Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties

Beware Of Bikes

Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties
Action
Adventure
RPG
Beat 'Em Up
Systems
Released
February 11, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Rating Pending
Developer(s)
Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Nintendo Switch 2, PC
Powered by
  • Planned Release Date: 2/12/26
  • Planned Systems: PC, PS4, PS5, Switch 2, Xbox Series X/S

Yakuza 3 was originally released in 2010 in North America for the PS3, and now it is returning once again with Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties . It’s a remaster/remake which adds some new content, most notably giving players the perspective of one of the game’s core villains, Yoshitaka.

As either Yoshitaka or the main star of the Yakuza series, Kazuma, players can brawl in intense combat with their fists or anything they find in the streets, like a bike. Players can customize their moves with skill points and learn new combos so that they can look even more stylish in the streets of Japan.

Dynasty Warriors 3: Complete Edition Remastered

Celebrating 25 Years

Dynasty Warriors 3 Complete Edition Remastered
Hack and Slash
Action
Systems
Released
March 19, 2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Rating Pending
Developer(s)
Omega Force
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by
  • Planned Release Date: 3/19/26
  • Planned Systems: PC, PS5, Switch, Switch 2, Xbox Series X/S

Dynasty Warriors 3: Complete Edition Remastered is another remaster/remake, but this one is based on an even older game. Dynasty Warriors 3 set the world ablaze on the PS2 in 2001, giving players dozens of characters to play with.

It’s a big reason why fans of the Dynasty Warriors series keep coming back because they know they can enjoy some intense combat with varied characters, from sword users to those who wield mighty spears. Also, building up the Musou meter to perform flashy attacks on battlefields filled with hundreds of enemies never gets old.

Glaciered

Ice Age

Glaciered
Action
Adventure
RPG
Soulslike
Exploration
Systems
Released
2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Studio Snowblind
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch 2, PC
Powered by
  • Planned Release Date: Q1 2026
  • Planned Systems: PC and Switch 2

Glaciered is one of the most unique games coming out in 2026, as it’s technically a post-apocalyptic RPG. The Earth has been frozen, and all life now resides underwater. Players are a new type of hybrid creature called a Tuai, who can learn magical techniques and equip blade-like weapons on their wings.

Mutations can lead to stat boosts and abilities, while the blades are sort of loot-based, like in a Diablo game. For an undersea adventure, an area of gaming most players find annoying to navigate, Glaciered’s combat looks intense and fluid in the best way.

Limit Zero Breakers

Breaking Anime Combos

  • Developer: VIC GAME STUDIOS
  • Publisher: NCSOFT Corporation
  • Planned Release Date: TBA
  • Planned Systems: Mobile and PC

Limit Zero Breakers is another free-to-play game, although it looks much different compared to Where Winds Meet since it has an anime aesthetic. Also, the game takes place within floating continents and fleets of airships, harkening back to the 90s when floating islands seemed more prevalent in media.

Players can build a party and bring them into combat, which seems to focus on building skill chains and breaking through enemy defenses. Also, while most of the game is single-player, there are dungeons and raid areas that will support three-player co-op.

Abyss X Zero

A PS1-Era Epic

Powered by
  • Planned Release Date: TBA
  • Planned Systems: PC

Anyone looking for Capcom to make another Mega Man Legends game may be waiting a long time. However, anyone who misses the gameplay style of The Legend of Zelda , meets Metroid exploration and puzzle solving with PS1 era graphics, should look into Abyss X Zero .

Players can control two characters separate from one another, Codename A and Codename Z, and explore dungeons, fighting deadly looking robots with melee and ranged combat along the way. Studio Pixel Punk is developing it, and if it’s anything like their previous 2021 game, Unsighted, players can expect some intense combat in Abyss X Zero .
